intro: Osbeckia tubulosa, commonly known as the slender tubularweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer to early autumn. Osbeckia tubulosa is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
